abstract: At a hedge fund conference, the activist investor spars with Laurence Fink over exchange-traded funds.
snippet: At a hedge fund conference, the activist investor spars with Laurence Fink over exchange-traded funds.
lead_paragraph: It was billed as a debate over the merits of shareholder activism, with two lions of Wall Street facing off: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire investor, and Laurence D. Fink, the chief executive of BlackRock, one of the world’s largest money management firms.

headline.main: Carl Icahn Calls BlackRock a ‘Very Dangerous Company’

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Alexandra Stevenson
